name: NY Vir
scenarioDescription:
The NY Vir Exoplanetary System


Overview

NY Vir is a star with 0.46 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.15 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

NY Vir is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the NY Vir system


NY Vir b

NY Vir b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 3.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of NY Vir b is 731.4 times the mass of Earth. The radius of NY Vir b is 13.3 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, NY Vir b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


NY Vir c

NY Vir c was discovered by the undefined observatory using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of NY Vir c is 1761.72 times the mass of Earth. The radius of NY Vir c is 12.8 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, NY Vir c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system NY Vir, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
